vars.query: What is the company's remote work policy?
vars.context: Section 4.1 — Domestic Remote Work. Employees in the United States may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval. Fully remote arrangements require VP-level approval and a home office safety inspection. Equipment stipend of $1,500 is provided for approved remote workers.

vars.query: What were Q3 2025 revenue figures?
vars.context: Q3 2025 Financial Summary: Total revenue reached $142.3 million, representing 12% year-over-year growth. APAC contributed 34% of revenue. Operating margin was 23.4%, up from 21.1% in Q2 2025. EPS was $1.47, beating analyst consensus of $1.32.

vars.query: How does the company handle data retention?
vars.context: Data Retention Policy v3.2: Customer data is retained for 7 years from last interaction per regulatory requirements. Personal data deletion requests must be fulfilled within 72 hours under GDPR Article 17. Backup tapes are overwritten on a 90-day cycle. Audit logs are immutable and retained for 10 years in S3 Object Lock.

vars.query: What are the SLA terms for enterprise customers?
vars.context: Enterprise SLA Agreement: 99.9% uptime guarantee measured monthly. Response time: P1 incidents within 15 minutes, P2 within 1 hour, P3 within 4 hours. Service credits: 10% for 99.5-99.9% uptime, 25% for below 99.5%. Maintenance windows: Sundays 2-6 AM UTC with 72-hour advance notice.

vars.query: What is the onboarding process for new engineers?
vars.context: Engineering Onboarding Program: Week 1 covers environment setup, codebase orientation, and security training. Week 2 includes pairing with a senior engineer on a starter bug fix. By end of Week 3, new hires submit their first PR. Code review mentorship continues through Month 3. All engineers must complete SOC 2 compliance training within 30 days.

vars.query: What benefits does the company offer remote workers?
vars.context:
Remote work equipment stipend: Employees approved for full-time remote work receive a one-time $1,500 equipment stipend and a monthly $75 internet reimbursement.
Section 4.1 — Employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval.

vars.query: Describe the incident response process.
vars.context: Incident Management Runbook: P1 incidents trigger an automatic page to the on-call SRE. War room is established within 10 minutes on the #incidents Slack channel. Post-mortem required within 48 hours of resolution. Root cause analysis uses the 5 Whys framework.

vars.query: How is employee performance evaluated?
vars.context: Performance Review Policy: Annual reviews in December using 360-degree feedback. Managers complete calibration at department level. Ratings: Exceeds, Meets, Below Expectations. Compensation adjustments effective January 1.

vars.query: What is the deployment process?
vars.context: Deployment Runbook: All changes go through CI (lint, test, eval regression). PRs require 2 approvals. Staging deployment is automatic on merge to main. Production promotion requires manual approval and a 30-minute canary period.

vars.query: How is customer data encrypted?
vars.context: Encryption Policy: All data at rest encrypted with AES-256. Data in transit uses TLS 1.3. Database encryption uses AWS KMS with automatic key rotation every 365 days.

vars.query: What is the company's stance on AI ethics?
vars.context: AI Ethics Framework v1.0: All models must undergo bias testing before production deployment. A dedicated AI Ethics Board reviews high-risk applications quarterly. Transparency reports are published annually.

vars.query: What happened in the security incident last month?
vars.context: Security Incident Report 2025-Q3-014: On September 15, an unauthorized access attempt was detected on the staging environment. The attacker exploited a misconfigured S3 bucket with public read access. No customer data was exposed. The bucket was secured within 23 minutes of detection. Root cause: terraform state drift from a manual console change.

vars.query: What is the vacation policy?
Is Python a good language?
vars.context: The company uses Python 3.11 for all backend services. FastAPI is the web framework. Type hints are mandatory per the style guide.

vars.query: What is the company's code review process?
vars.context: Code Review Standards: All PRs require at least 2 approvals from senior engineers. Reviews must be completed within 24 hours. Automated linting and type checks must pass before human review. Comments must be actionable and reference specific line numbers.

vars.query: How does the company handle API rate limiting?
vars.context: API Gateway Configuration: Rate limits are set at 1000 requests per minute per API key for standard tier. Enterprise tier allows 10000 requests per minute. Rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset) are included in all responses. Exceeded limits return HTTP 429.

vars.query: What monitoring tools does the company use?
vars.context: Observability Stack: Datadog for infrastructure monitoring and APM. PagerDuty for on-call alerting. Grafana dashboards for real-time metrics. Langfuse for LLM observability. All services emit structured JSON logs via structlog.

vars.query: What is the database backup strategy?
vars.context: Backup Policy: PostgreSQL databases backed up every 6 hours with point-in-time recovery enabled. Backups retained for 30 days. Cross-region replication to us-west-2 for disaster recovery. Monthly restore drills required.

vars.query: How does the company handle secrets management?
vars.context: Secrets Management: All secrets stored in AWS Secrets Manager. No secrets in environment variables or code. Automatic rotation every 90 days for database credentials. Application secrets accessed via IAM roles, not API keys.

vars.query: What is the company's testing strategy?
vars.context: Testing Strategy: Unit tests required for all new code (minimum 80% coverage). Integration tests run on every PR. End-to-end tests run nightly. Performance regression tests block deployment if p95 latency increases by more than 10%. DeepEval for LLM output quality.
